intro: Hoffmannseggella angereri, commonly known as the Angerer's hoffmannseggella, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Andes in South America. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers, gourds, and melons. The plant is characterized by its trailing growth habit and produces small, pale green flowers. Its fruits are typically small, round, and have a waxy coating. Hoffmannseggella angereri is often found in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, temperate climates.
